intro: Comparettia campoverdei, commonly known as the Campoverde's orchid, is a species native to the cloud forests of Central America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, epiphytic growth habit. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers in shades of white and yellow, often with a distinctive lip petal. Its leaves are typically dark green and革质 (leathery), adapted to retain moisture in its humid, shaded habitat. Due to its ornamental value and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
